title: After Trump claimed millions of dead people were getting social security checks, Trump’s pick to lead the agency disputes the statement
description: “The reported data are people in our records with a Social Security number who do not have a date of death associated with their record. These individuals are not necessarily receiving benefits," said acting SSA commissioner Lee Dudek.
author: Fatima Hussein, The Associated Press
excerpt: “The reported data are people in our records with a Social Security number who do not have a date of death associated with their record. These individuals are not necessarily receiving benefits," said acting SSA commissioner Lee Dudek.
text: US President Donald Trump walks on stage to speak at FII PRIORITY Miami 2025 Summit (Future Investment Initiative) at the Faena Hotel & Forum in Miami Beach, Florida, February 19, 2025. Photo by ROBERTO SCHMIDT/AFP via Getty Images
html:
US President Donald Trump walks on stage to speak at FII PRIORITY Miami 2025 Summit (Future Investment Initiative) at the Faena Hotel & Forum in Miami Beach, Florida, February 19, 2025.
